options.content:
# Welcome to our ASSUME demo

This is the Grafana Dashboard which makes interacting with the simulation data very easy.

# Market-specific Data

Data specific for the market depending on the choice made at te top of the panel

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  product_start AS "time",
  supply_volume
FROM market_meta
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(product_start)
ORDER BY 1

panels.description: Overview of market results for the chossen market

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  product_start AS "time",
  demand_volume AS "Demand Volume",
  supply_volume AS "Supply Volume"
FROM market_meta
WHERE ("simulation" LIKE '$simulation') AND ("market_id" LIKE '$market') AND $__timeFilter(product_start)
GROUP BY market_id, simulation, product_start, demand_volume, supply_volume
ORDER BY 1;

SELECT
  product_start AS "time",
  price AS "Price"
FROM market_meta
WHERE ("simulation" LIKE '$simulation') AND ("market_id" LIKE '$market') AND $__timeFilter(product_start)
GROUP BY market_id, simulation, product_start, price
ORDER BY 1;

panels.title: Market Summary $market

panels.description: Bid prices of accepted bids per unit in the chosen market

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  $__timeGroupAlias(start_time,$__interval),
  avg(original_price) AS " ",
  bid_id AS "bid_id"
FROM market_orders
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(start_time) AND
  market_id = '$market' AND
  simulation = '$simulation'
GROUP BY 1, bid_id
ORDER BY 1

panels.title: Accepted Bid Prices

panels.description: Accepted Volume  per unit in chosen market

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  $__timeGroupAlias(start_time,$__interval),
  avg(volume) AS " ",
  bid_id AS "bid_id"
FROM market_orders
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(start_time) AND
  market_id = '$market' AND
  simulation = '$simulation'
GROUP BY 1, bid_id
ORDER BY 1

panels.title: Accepted Bid Volume

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  simulation,
  sum(round(CAST(value AS numeric), 2))  FILTER (WHERE variable = 'total_cost') as "Total cost",
  sum(round(CAST(value AS numeric), 2))  FILTER (WHERE variable = 'total_volume') as "Total volume"
FROM kpis
group by simulation
ORDER BY simulation

SELECT
  simulation,
  sum(round(CAST(value AS numeric), 2))  FILTER (WHERE variable = 'avg_price') as avg_price,
  sum(round(CAST(value AS numeric), 2))  FILTER (WHERE variable = 'total_cost') as total_cost,
  sum(round(CAST(value AS numeric), 2)*1000)  FILTER (WHERE variable = 'total_volume') as total_volume,
  sum(round(CAST(value AS numeric), 2))  FILTER (WHERE variable = 'sum_reward') as sum_reward,
  sum(round(CAST(value AS numeric), 2))  FILTER (WHERE variable = 'sum_profit') as sum_profit,
  sum(round(CAST(value AS numeric), 2))  FILTER (WHERE variable = 'sum_regret') as sum_regret
FROM kpis
group by simulation
ORDER BY simulation

panels.description: Shows installed capacities in the simulation based on the fuel type

targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
  NOW() as time_sec,
  SUM(max_power),
  technology
FROM power_plant_meta
WHERE "simulation" LIKE '$simulation'
GROUP BY technology, simulation;

panels.title: Installed Generation Capacities

options.content:
# Unit Specific Data

For the chosen market and the chosen unit here the dispatch is displayed.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  "Timestamp" AS "time",
  volume
FROM demand_meta
WHERE
  $__timeFilter("Timestamp")
ORDER BY 1

SELECT
  $__timeGroupAlias(datetime,$__interval),
  power AS "market_dispatch",
  unit_id,
  market_id
FROM market_dispatch
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(datetime) AND
  simulation = '$simulation' AND
  unit_id in ($Gen_Units)
GROUP BY 1, unit_id, power, market_id
ORDER BY 1

SELECT
  $__timeGroupAlias(index,$__interval),
  power AS "dispatch",
  unit
FROM unit_dispatch
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(index) AND
  simulation = '$simulation' AND
  unit in ($Gen_Units)
GROUP BY 1, unit, power
ORDER BY 1

options.content:
### General Information Name: {{index}}
Technology: {{technology}}
### Technical Specifications Emissions: {{emission_factor}} t/MWh
Maximum Power: {{max_power}} MW
Minimum Power: {{min_power}} MW
Efficiency: {{efficiency}}
##### Unit Operator: {{unit_operator}}
options.defaultContent: The query didn't return any results.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT * FROM power_plant_meta
WHERE index in ($Gen_Units) and simulation = '$simulation'

panels.description: Bid prices of accepted bids per unit in the chosen market

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  $__timeGroupAlias(start_time,$__interval),
  accepted_price AS "market_price",
  price AS "bid_price",
  concat(unit_id, ' - ', market_id) as "unit_id"
FROM market_orders
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(start_time) AND
  unit_id in ($Gen_Units) AND
  simulation = '$simulation'
GROUP BY 1, unit_id, market_id, price, accepted_price
ORDER BY 1

panels.title: Accepted Bid Prices

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  $__timeGroupAlias(start_time,$__interval),
  avg(accepted_volume) AS "accepted_volume",
  unit_id
FROM market_orders
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(start_time) AND
  unit_id in ($Gen_Units) AND
  simulation = '$simulation'
GROUP BY 1, unit_id
ORDER BY 1

SELECT
  $__timeGroupAlias(start_time,$__interval),
  avg(volume) AS "bid_volume",
  unit_id
FROM market_orders
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(start_time) AND
  unit_id in ($Gen_Units) AND
  simulation = '$simulation'
GROUP BY 1, unit_id
ORDER BY 1

SELECT
  $__timeGroupAlias(index,$__interval),
  energy_cashflow AS "energy_cashflow",
  unit
FROM unit_dispatch
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(index) AND
  simulation = '$simulation' AND
  unit in ($Gen_Units)
GROUP BY 1, unit, energy_cashflow
ORDER BY 1

SELECT
  $__timeGroupAlias(index,$__interval),
  energy_marginal_costs AS "energy_marginal_costs",
  unit
FROM unit_dispatch
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(index) AND
  simulation = '$simulation' AND
  unit in ($Gen_Units)
GROUP BY 1, unit, energy_marginal_costs
ORDER BY 1

SELECT
  $__timeGroupAlias(datetime,$__interval),
  power AS "power",
  unit_id,
  market_id
FROM market_dispatch
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(datetime) AND
  simulation = '$simulation' AND
  unit_id in ($Demand_Units)
GROUP BY 1, unit_id, power, market_id
ORDER BY 1

SELECT
  $__timeGroupAlias(index,$__interval),
  power AS "dispatch",
  unit
FROM unit_dispatch
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(index) AND
  simulation = '$simulation' AND
  unit in ($Demand_Units)
GROUP BY 1, unit, power
ORDER BY 1

FROM unit_dispatch
WHERE

GROUP BY 1, unit, energy_marginal_costs
ORDER BY 1

SELECT
  $__timeGroupAlias(start_time,$__interval),
  avg(accepted_volume) AS "accepted_volume",
  unit_id
FROM market_orders

  power AS "power",
  unit_id,
  market_id
FROM market_dispatch
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(datetime) AND
  simulation = '$simulation' AND
  unit_id in ($Storage_Units)
GROUP BY 1, unit_id, power, market_id
ORDER BY 1

SELECT
  $__timeGroupAlias(index,$__interval),
  power AS "dispatch",
  unit
FROM unit_dispatch
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(index) AND
  simulation = '$simulation' AND
  unit in ($Storage_Units)
GROUP BY 1, unit, power
ORDER BY 1

SELECT
  $__timeGroupAlias(index,$__interval),
  SOC AS "State of Charge",
  unit
FROM unit_dispatch
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(index) AND
  simulation = '$simulation' AND
  unit in ($Storage_Units)
GROUP BY 1, unit, SOC
ORDER BY 1

list.definition:
-- this construct is needed to execute a join query if rl_params exist
-- else execute a query without a join on rl_params
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION get_simulation_data()
RETURNS TABLE (
  market_simulation TEXT
) AS $$
BEGIN
  IF EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM information_schema.tables WHERE table_name = 'rl_params') THEN
    -- Table rl_params exists, execute the join query
    RETURN QUERY EXECUTE '
      SELECT DISTINCT
        m.simulation AS market_simulation
      FROM 
        market_meta m
      LEFT OUTER JOIN
        rl_params o
      ON
        m.simulation = o.simulation
      WHERE
        o.learning_mode is not true
    ';
  ELSE
    -- Table rl_params doesn't exist, execute the query for market_meta only
    RETURN QUERY EXECUTE '
      SELECT DISTINCT
        simulation AS market_simulation
      FROM 
        market_meta
    ';
  END IF;
END;
$$ LANGUAGE plpgsql;

SELECT * FROM get_simulation_data();
list.description: Can choose which simulation we want to show
list.name: simulation
list.query:
-- this construct is needed to execute a join query if rl_params exist
-- else execute a query without a join on rl_params
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION get_simulation_data()
RETURNS TABLE (
  market_simulation TEXT
) AS $$
BEGIN
  IF EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM information_schema.tables WHERE table_name = 'rl_params') THEN
    -- Table rl_params exists, execute the join query
    RETURN QUERY EXECUTE '
      SELECT DISTINCT
        m.simulation AS market_simulation
      FROM 
        market_meta m
      LEFT OUTER JOIN
        rl_params o
      ON
        m.simulation = o.simulation
      WHERE
        o.learning_mode is not true
    ';
  ELSE
    -- Table rl_params doesn't exist, execute the query for market_meta only
    RETURN QUERY EXECUTE '
      SELECT DISTINCT
        simulation AS market_simulation
      FROM 
        market_meta
    ';
  END IF;
END;
$$ LANGUAGE plpgsql;

SELECT * FROM get_simulation_data();

list.definition:
SELECT 
  market_id
FROM market_meta
where simulation='$simulation'
group by market_id ;
list.description: Choose for which market the data is displayed

  market_id
FROM market_meta
where simulation='$simulation'
group by market_id ;
